other_tests.findings: Initial ERCP showed diffuse attenuation of the common bile duct and a smooth stricture, 3 mm in length, in the distal third of the duct. Focal narrowing at the origin of the left hepatic duct was also noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A follow-up ERCP performed nine weeks later showed resolution of the stricture in the common bile duct but persistent irregularity of the pancreatic duct and complete obstruction of the main pancreatic duct at the level of the pancreatic neck.

other_tests.findings: Pancreatic parenchymal abnormalities consisting of hyperechoic strands, hypoechoic foci, lobularity, and shadowing foci, suggestive of inflammatory or malignant infiltration.
Specimen contained many benign acini and few ducts, thick bands of dense collagen, little inflammation, and no malignant cells.
A rock-hard pancreas with an enlarged head, moderate inflammatory changes outside the pancreas, stenosis of the common bile duct, and a stenotic main pancreatic duct.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Histologic examination revealed a marked, chronic lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate around the main duct and medium-sized interlobular ducts.
